title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
The default configuration in the Dynamic Content Elements (dce) extension before 0.11.5 for TYPO3 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive installation environment information by reading the update check request.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-8328
  • https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/97673
  • http://typo3.org/extensions/repository/view/dce
  • http://typo3.org/teams/security/security-bulletins/typo3-extensions/typo3-ext-sa-2014-015/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v4vm-gj2x-6qhm
items.title: [t3/dce] DCE extension for Typo3 Discloses Environment Information

items.content_html:
The blind-marking implementation in Moodle through 2.3.11, 2.4.x before 2.4.10, 2.5.x before 2.5.6, and 2.6.x before 2.6.3 allows remote authenticated users to de-anonymize student identities by (1) using a screen reader or (2) reading the HTML source.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-0215
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=260363
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/05/19/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2fmv-j5xj-4fmq
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Reveals Student Information Meant To Be Anonymous

items.content_html:
The blind-marking implementation in Moodle through 2.3.11, 2.4.x before 2.4.10, 2.5.x before 2.5.6, and 2.6.x before 2.6.3 allows remote authenticated users to de-anonymize student identities by (1) using a screen reader or (2) reading the HTML source.

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Reveals Student Information Meant To Be Anonymous

items.content_html:
The generate_password function in Moodle through 2.4.11, 2.5.x before 2.5.9, 2.6.x before 2.6.6, and 2.7.x before 2.7.3 does not provide a sufficient number of possible temporary passwords, which allows remote attackers to obtain access via a brute-force attack.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-7845
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=275152
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-47050
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/11/17/11
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20150914064838/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1031215
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9v64-447r-wch6
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Temporary Passwords are Brute Force-able

The generate_password function in Moodle through 2.4.11, 2.5.x before 2.5.9, 2.6.x before 2.6.6, and 2.7.x before 2.7.3 does not provide a sufficient number of possible temporary passwords, which allows remote attackers to obtain access via a brute-force attack.

items.content_html:
Moodle through 2.3.11, 2.4.x before 2.4.11, 2.5.x before 2.5.7, 2.6.x before 2.6.4, and 2.7.x before 2.7.1 allows remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary code via a calculated question in a quiz.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-3545
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=264266
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-46148
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/07/21/1
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/blob/1474f74687dda57c7d011b92d16f25b9870d2799/question/type/calculated/question.php#L426
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3m99-h3hp-w9j7
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle remote code execution via quiz questions

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle remote code execution via quiz questions

items.content_html:
mod/imscp/locallib.php in Moodle through 2.3.11, 2.4.x before 2.4.11, 2.5.x before 2.5.7, 2.6.x before 2.6.4, and 2.7.x before 2.7.1 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a package with a manifest file containing an XML external entity declaration in conjunction with an entity reference, related to an XML External Entity (XXE) issue affecting IMSCP resources and the IMSCC format.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-3543
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=264264
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/07/21/1
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/595ef4772d330a20c757635ab090acdcc9b2a2fa
  • https://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=595ef4772d330a20c757635ab090acdcc9b2a2fa
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-27j2-c838-c3qg
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Arbitrary File Read via XML External Entity vulnerability

items.content_html:
mod/imscp/locallib.php in Moodle through 2.3.11, 2.4.x before 2.4.11, 2.5.x before 2.5.7, 2.6.x before 2.6.4, and 2.7.x before 2.7.1 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a package with a manifest file containing an XML external entity declaration in conjunction with an entity reference, related to an XML External Entity (XXE) issue affecting IMSCP resources and the IMSCC format.

References

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.5, 4.1.x before 4.1.14.6, and 4.2.x before 4.2.10.1 allow remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted (1) database name or (2) table name, related to the libraries/DatabaseInterface.class.php code for SQL debug output and the js/server_status_monitor.js code for the server monitor page.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-8326
  • https://github.com/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin/commit/7b8962dede7631298c81e2c1cd267b81f1e08a8c
  • https://github.com/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin/commit/bd68c54d1beeef79d237e8bfda44690834012a76
  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2014-11/msg00004.html
  • http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2014-12.php
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200228163625/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/70731
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pvr5-84gr-g985
items.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin Implementation XSS Vulnerability on Server Monitor Page

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.5, 4.1.x before 4.1.14.6, and 4.2.x before 4.2.10.1 allow remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted (1) database name or (2) table name, related to the libraries/DatabaseInterface.class.php code for SQL debug output and the js/server_status_monitor.js code for the server monitor page.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-8326
  • https://github.com/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin/commit/7b8962dede7631298c81e2c1cd267b81f1e08a8c

  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2014-11/msg00004.html

items.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin Implementation XSS Vulnerability on Server Monitor Page

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.5, 4.1.x before 4.1.14.6, and 4.2.x before 4.2.10.1 allow remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted (1) database name or (2) table name, related to the libraries/DatabaseInterface.class.php code for SQL debug output and the js/server_status_monitor.js code for the server monitor page.

References

items.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin Implementation XSS Vulnerability on Server Monitor Page

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the micro history implementation in phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.3, 4.1.x before 4.1.14.4, and 4.2.x before 4.2.8.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML, and consequently conduct a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attack to create a root account, via a crafted URL, related to js/ajax.js.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-6300
  • https://github.com/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin/commit/33b39f9f1dd9a4d27856530e5ac004e23b30e8ac
  • https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201505-03
  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2014-09/msg00032.html
  • http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2014-10.php
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200228081340/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/69790
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6wfj-2mw7-p5cg
items.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin micro history Implementation XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the micro history implementation in phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.3, 4.1.x before 4.1.14.4, and 4.2.x before 4.2.8.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML, and consequently conduct a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attack to create a root account, via a crafted URL, related to js/ajax.js.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-6300
  • https://github.com/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin/commit/33b39f9f1dd9a4d27856530e5ac004e23b30e8ac
  • https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201505-03
  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2014-09/msg00032.html
  • http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2014-10.php
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200228081340/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/69790
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6wfj-2mw7-p5cg
items.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin micro history Implementation XSS Vulnerability
